title: Oak Glen off to 10-0 start | News, Sports, Jobs - The Review
text: Oak Glen off to 10-0 start NEW MANCHESTER, W.Va. — Oak Glen moved to 10-0 on the season by sweeping Indian Creek, 25-11, 25-10, 25-14, Wednesday. McKenzi Martin had 15 kills and eight digs and Brooklyn Six had 11 kills for the Golden Bears. Averi Martin collected five kills, Mattie Carney and Tia Vick each had four kills, Reecelyn Craig three kills and two blocks, Tia Vick 10 aces and eight digs, Addison Smith 14 digs and Mikalyn Balch had 35 assists and five aces. Oak Glen also won the junior varsity match, 25-22, 25-20. Mattie Carney and Zoey Caughey each had eight kills for the Golden Bears. Layla Skavenski had eight digs,, Darias Price four kills and five assists, Kylie Robinson two kills, Ava Anderson tree digs and Ellie Smith 11 assists. Southern 3, Toronto 2 TORONTO — Southern rallied from two games down to beat Toronto, 20-25, 18-25, 25-22, 25-19, 15-5, Wednesday. The Indians improve to 4-2 and will host Weirton Madonna on Monday. Cheyenne Bennett totaled 14 points and 21 assists for Southern. Cheyenne Buzzard collected 13 points and three kills, Brooke Boyle seven points and 10 digs, Gigi Rodgers nine kills and six points, Gianna Pecorelli six points and four kills, Kennedy Lewis four points and 14 digs, Kiah Sloan 14 kills and four blocks and Allyssa Shroades 12 kills and 20 assists. Southern also won the junior varsity match, 25-21, 25-22, as Emerson Gotschall served six points.
